Module c195.c195assessment
Package c195.c195assessment.controller

Class CustomerController

java.lang.Object
c195.c195assessment.controller.CustomerController
public class CustomerController extends Object
Controller for the customer management view. Manages the display of customers in a table view, and handles navigation to add, modify, and delete customer operations.

  • Constructor Details

    • CustomerController

      public CustomerController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Initializes the controller. Sets up the table columns and loads all customers from the database into the table view. Also sets up a listener to refresh the table view whenever the window gains focus.

    • getAllCustomers

      public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customer> getAllCustomers()
      Retrieves the observable list containing all customers currently loaded into the table view. This list is used to populate the customer table view in the UI.
      Returns:
      An ObservableList of Customer objects representing all customers.

    • setAllCustomers

      public void setAllCustomers(javafx.collections.ObservableList<Customer> allCustomers)
      Sets the observable list containing all customers to be displayed in the table view. This method allows updating the list of customers shown in the UI, typically after retrieving updated data from the database.
      Parameters:
      allCustomers - An ObservableList of Customer objects to be displayed in the table view.

    • addCustomerButtonHandler

      public void addCustomerButtonHandler(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles action on the "Add Customer" button. Switches the scene to the form for adding a new customer.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event that triggered this method.

    • modifyCustomerButtonHandler

      public void modifyCustomerButtonHandler(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles action on the "Modify Customer" button. Requires a customer to be selected from the table view. If a customer is selected, switches the scene to the form for modifying the selected customer.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event that triggered this method.

    • deleteCustomerButtonHandler

      public void deleteCustomerButtonHandler()
      Handles action on the "Delete Customer" button. Requires a customer to be selected from the table view. If a customer is selected, prompts for confirmation and then attempts to delete the customer from the database.

    • returnToApptButtonHandler

      public void returnToApptButtonHandler(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Handles action on the "Return to Appointments" button. Switches the scene back to the main appointment view.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event that triggered this method.
